title: Hireup Support Worker Rates 2026: Complete Pay & Pricing Guide for Workers and Clients
description: Comprehensive guide to Hireup support worker rates in 2026. Detailed breakdown of hourly pay rates for workers, client pricing, weekend and public holiday rates, how Hireup compares to other NDIS platforms, and what to consider when choosing a provider.
content:
What is Hireup?

Hireup is one of Australia's largest online platforms connecting NDIS participants with support workers. Unlike traditional disability service providers, Hireup operates as an employment platform—all support workers on Hireup are directly employed by the company as casual employees, not independent contractors.

This employment model means Hireup handles superannuation contributions, workers' compensation insurance, public liability insurance, tax withholding (PAYG), and SCHADS Award compliance.

Hireup Client Pricing 2026-27

Standard Hourly Rates (for shifts 2 hours or longer)

Time PeriodClient Rate
Weekday (6am-8pm)$69.09/hour
Weekday Evening (8pm-12am)$75.88/hour
Weekday Night (12am-6am)$77.23/hour
Saturday (all day)$90.27/hour
Sunday (all day)$116.23/hour
Public Holiday (all day)$150.93/hour

Short shifts (under 2 hours) cost more per hour due to minimum 2-hour payment requirements under the SCHADS Award.

Hireup Support Worker Pay Rates 2026

Hourly Pay Rates (for shifts 2 hours or longer)

Time PeriodPay Rate (excl. super)Total Package
Weekday (6am-8pm)$42.57/hour$47.47/hour
Saturday (all day)$58.98/hour$65.76/hour
Sunday (all day)$76.09/hour$84.84/hour
Public Holiday (all day)$93.52/hour$104.27/hour

All rates include 25% casual loading and comply with the SCHADS Award.

Hireup vs Mable Comparison

FeatureHireupMable
Worker StatusEmployed (casual)Independent contractor
Client Weekday Rate$69.09/hour~$63/hour average
Rate FlexibilityFixed ratesWorkers set own rates
InsuranceProvided by HireupWorkers arrange own
SuperPaid by HireupWorkers manage own
NDIS RegistrationYesNo (platform only)

Who Can Use Hireup?

All NDIS plan management types can use Hireup:

  • Agency-Managed: Yes - Hireup is a registered NDIS provider
  • Plan-Managed: Yes - Can use registered or unregistered providers
  • Self-Managed: Yes - Can use any provider

NDIS Price Limits vs Hireup Rates

Hireup's rates fall within or below NDIS price limits:

  • NDIS Weekday Limit: $70.23/hour | Hireup: $69.09/hour
  • NDIS Saturday Limit: $98.16/hour | Hireup: $90.27/hour
  • NDIS Sunday Limit: $126.09/hour | Hireup: $116.23/hour

Pros and Cons of Hireup

Advantages

  • Large network of vetted support workers
  • All workers employed, insured, and trained
  • Transparent pricing
  • App-based booking
  • Registered NDIS provider (works with all plan types)

Disadvantages

  • Fixed rates—cannot negotiate
  • May cost more than independent workers on Mable
  • Limited to workers on the platform

How MD Home Care Compares

At MD Home Care, we offer an alternative to platform-based services with dedicated care managers, hand-picked workers, clinical oversight from registered nurses, and local expertise across Sydney and Melbourne. We provide transparent pricing with low management fees (15%) and no hidden costs.
